content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. <math alttext="W of t equals, seventeen halves, minus, three halves times, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi t over 6, close parenthesis, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 6; W of t equals, 10 minus, one fifth times, open parenthesis, t minus 6, close parenthesis, squared, for 6 less than t, less than or equal to 10"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>10</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>6</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> The depth of a river at a certain point is modeled by the function <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above, where <math alttext="W of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in feet and time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hours. (a) Find <math alttext="W prime of 8"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math alttext="W prime of 8"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. <math alttext="W of t equals, seventeen halves, minus, three halves times, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi t over 6, close parenthesis, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 6; W of t equals, 10 minus, one fifth times, open parenthesis, t minus 6, close parenthesis, squared, for 6 less than t, less than or equal to 10"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>10</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>6</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> The depth of a river at a certain point is modeled by the function <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above, where <math alttext="W of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in feet and time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hours. (a) Find <math alttext="W prime of 8"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math alttext="W prime of 8"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

(b) The graph of <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down for <math alttext="3 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 3.5"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="t equals 3 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to show that <math alttext="W of 3.5, is less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Find <math alttext="the limit as t approaches 2, of, the fraction with numerator W of t, minus t cubed, plus one fourth, and denominator t minus 2, end fraction."><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
